title: FedEx Reports Earnings Next Week. Here’s How to Play It.
text:
Text size

Photograph by Justin Sullivan/Getty Images

FedEx reports its quarterly results on Tuesday—and good luck trying to predict how the stock will react.

The express shipper is expected to report a profit of $3.17 a share during its fiscal first quarter on sales of $17.1 billion, according to FactSet. But knowing whether FedEx (ticker: FDX) will beat or miss hasn’t always been much of a help. In the recent past, shares have traded down after beating Wall Street expectations and traded higher after management offered weak earnings guidance.

In fact, trading earnings reports amounts to a parlay bet. In that kind of wager, multiple things have to happen before investors can cash in. For quarterly earnings, investors need to not only deduce what a company will report but also how the market will react to the news. For example, FedEx stock jumped 3% in July even after management said fiscal-year 2020 earnings would fall by “mid-single-digit” percentage points because of a weaker economy and trade uncertainty, among other factors.
description: FedEx reports its quarterly results on Tuesday—and good luck trying to predict how the stock will react. Long-term investors shouldn’t fret.
